jobDescription: Back to Search ResultsSLAC National Accelerator Laboratory is one of 17 Department of Energy (DOE) National Laboratories, and operated by Stanford University on behalf of the DOE. SLAC develops and operates some of the world’s premier science facilities, including the first hard X-ray free-electron laser. Research at SLAC explores the structure and function of matter and the properties of energy, space and time, at the smallest and largest scales, all with the goal of solving problems facing society and advancing human knowledge. Staff Scientist- Associate Job Requisition #: 3215 Classification Title: Staff Scientist- Associate Grade: NA Location: Menlo Park, CA (HQ) # of openings: 1 DescriptionPOSITION OVERVIEW: The Grid Integration Systems, and Mobility Group at SLAC is currently seeking an associate staff scientist to lead research efforts in vehicle-to-grid and mobility studies. The candidate is expected to bring strong expertise in computer science, machine learning, software development and programming.  The candidate will lead engineering and scientific research, and is expected to support the development of data-driven methods to facilitate integration of renewable energy sources, increase energy efficiency, and enable active participation of electric vehicles in the smart grid. JOB PURPOSE: Apply knowledge and understanding of computer science, software development and programming in laboratories engaged in research in the physical sciences. CORE DUTIES*:Consider, select and broadly apply principles, theories and concepts in multiple fields of specialization, with particular emphasis on two or more of the following: electric vehicles, electric power systems, renewable energy systems, transportation and/or control theory.Lead the design and setup of data-driven models and data analytics platforms.Lead analysis and interpretation of research data to recognize irregularities and invalid results, organize data, and develop models allowing for integration and display of data.Lead preparation of papers for publication and scientific and program reporting.Support collaborations with SLAC scientists, post-docs, and Stanford faculty.Work with other academic institutions, industry, and other DOE laboratories on interdisciplinary research.* - Other duties may also be assignedNote: The Associate Staff Scientist position is the entry level in the Staff Scientist career path. The Associate Staff Scientist is a 3 to 5 year fixed term research staff position. The second level of this career path, Staff Scientist is a regular continuing position. The Associate position is scheduled to be assessed after the 3 to 5 year period with the possibility of appointment to the Staff Scientist level. Appointment to the Staff Scientist level requires a review and evaluation of documented scientific achievement.
